pull_request.title: Feat: Add aria attributes to sidebar toggle, search field, and current page
pull_request.body:
## Summary

These updates align with accessibility best practices.

1. Add aria roles to sidebar and sidebar toggle to indicate hidden/visible state
2. Add `aria-current="page"` attribute to active sidebar link
3. Update `aria-label` vale of search plugin's input field

## Related issue, if any:

#658
#2226 

## What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- Feature

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

No

## Tested in the following browsers:

- [x] Chrome
- [x] Firefox
- [x] Safari
- [x] Edge

commits.message: Add select elements to list of ignored elements

issue.title: Relative path link with ':ignore' dosen't work
issue.body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template or we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Please use English language -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of Docsify. -->
<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=docsify -->
<!-- Please ask questions on Discord: https://discord.gg/3NwKFyR -->

## Bug Report

As far as I know, there are no same issues on here, no same questions on StackOverflow.
Sorry if already exist same one.

#### Steps to reproduce

0. File tree will be like this:

```
docs/
  |- index.html
  |- page/
        |- any_doc.md
        |- any_file.pdf
```

1. Add a docsify config to `index.html`:

```
relativePath: true
```

2. Write `any_doc.md`:

```md
[Click to view PDF](./any_file.pdf ':ignore')
```

3. Execute docsify:

```sh
docsify serve docs/
```

4. Make any PDF file as `docs/page/any_file.pdf`

5. Access to `http://localhost:3000/#/page/any_doc`

#### What is current behaviour

The link follows `http://localhost:3000/#/page/./any_file.pdf`

It looks `':ignore'` (no compile option) and relative path resolving are not works.

#### What is the expected behaviour

The link follows `http://localhost:3000/page/any_file.pdf`

#### Other relevant information

<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->
- [x] Bug does still occur when all/other plugins are disabled?

- Your OS: Linux Mint 20.3 Uma
- Node.js version: 16.16.0
- npm/yarn version: 9.1.2
- Browser version: Brave 1.45.127 Chromium: 107.0.5304.110（Official Build）
- Docsify version: 4.13.0
- Docsify plugins: *none (running in default)*

<!-- Love docsify? Please consider supporting our collective:
👉  https://opencollective.com/docsify/donate -->

#### Please create a reproducible sandbox

[![Edit 307qqv236](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/holy-frog-ol1642)

#### Mention the docsify version in which this bug was not present (if any)

---

## Supplement

I tried specifying absolute path like this:

```
[Click to view PDF](/page/any_file.pdf ':ignore')
```

It works on local environment. But on GitHub pages, not works.

On local environment:

follows: `http://localhost:3000/page/any_file.pdf`

On GitHub pages (github.io):

follows: `https://{user_name}.github.io/page/any_file.pdf`

should be: `https://{user_name}.github.io/{repo_name}/page/any_file.pdf`

comment.body:
Would it be better if the affected line changes to:

```js
document.URL.replace(/\/(?!.*\/).*/, '/').replace('#/./', '') + href.replace(/^\.\//, '/')
```

comment.body: This bug is still present and prevents linking to local files from within markdown. Is there any update on this?

issue.title: [DOCS] Add a CODE_OF_CONDUCT file to the repository
issue.body:
<!--
Please don't delete this template or we'll close your issue.
Please write in English.
Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of Docsify.
Please ask questions on StackOverflow (👉 https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=docsify)
or in our Discord chat server (👉 https://discord.gg/docsify).
-->

## Feature request

#### Problem or desire

The repository looks incomplete because of the missing CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md file to specify the rules and regulations to follow while contributing to the repository, I want to add that file to the repo.

#### Proposal

Add CODE_OF_CONDUCT file to the repository which guidelines.

Kindly assign me this issue.

issue.title: Tables render header text in every cell
issue.body:
Docsify versions affected: 4.9.1, 4.9.0, 4.8.x (maybe more)

When rendering a markdown table like this:
```
| foo | bar |
| --- | --- |
| 123 | 456 |
```

It renders like this:
![Screen Shot 2019-03-18 at 15 39 39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1770511/54538166-105c9080-4994-11e9-9d24-a4ee0c705baa.png)

The header text is rendered as `:before` pseudo elements via CSS put those should probably not be visible by default.

A quick fix is to include something like this in `index.html`:
```html
<style>
    td::before { display: none }
</style>
```

All themes seem to be affected.

issue.title: Feature: Change 'X' button style
issue.body:
<!--
Please don't delete this template or we'll close your issue.
Please write in English.
Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of Docsify.
Please ask questions on StackOverflow (👉 https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=docsify)
or in our Discord chat server (👉 https://discord.gg/docsify).
-->

## Feature request

#### Problem or desire

The size of the 'x' button near the search should have to be a little larger to be more consistent with the UI

<!-- Describe what problem this feature will solve. -->

#### Proposal

I will either scale it up a little bit or change the whole icon itself.

<!-- What does the proposed feature look like? -->

#### Implementation

To implement this, I'll change the styling of the button.

<!--
How should the feature be implemented in your opinion?

We have limited free time. Please consider contributing, or donating to our
OpenCollective (👉 https://opencollective.com/docsify/donate), to help get this
feature added and to advance Docsify.
 -->
![image](https://github.com/open-sauced/intro/assets/93720428/d5c5e888-2c86-4de2-b02a-2e11bc72d34e)

comment.body:
Hi @singodiyashubham87 , It seems not our official style, do you use some theme or custom styles?
If you could provide a demo site/codebase would be better.
